original: EXCLUSIVE LICENSE AND PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT AGREEMENT THIS EXCLUSIVE LICENSE AND PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT AGREEMENT (this “ Agreement ”) is entered into as of June 12, 2019 (the “Execution Date ”) by and between Eton Pharmaceuticals, Inc., a Delaware corporation with offices at 21925 W. Field Pkwy, Suite 235, Deer Park, Illinois, USA (“ ETON ”), and Aucta Pharmaceuticals, Inc., a Delaware corporation with offices at 71 Suttons Lane, Piscataway, NJ 08854 (“ Aucta ”) .

NON-EXCLUSIVE CONSULTING AND PRODUCT INNOVATION AGREEMENT

This NON-EXCLUSIVE Consulting and Product Innovation Agreement (hereinafter referred to as this "Agreement") is entered into on June 12, 2019 (the "Effective Date"), by and between Aucta Pharmaceuticals, Inc., a Delaware corporation with offices at 71 Suttons Lane, Piscataway, NJ 08854 ("Aucta"), and Eton Pharmaceuticals, Inc., a Delaware corporation with offices at 21925 W. Field Pkwy, Suite 235, Deer Park, Illinois, USA ("ETON").

In this Agreement, Aucta grants ETON the right to consult on a non-exclusive basis and collaborate in product innovation, rather than granting exclusive rights as stated in the original clause. This change allows both parties more freedom to engage in similar activities with other entities, while still maintaining their partnership for specified projects under this Agreement.

original: NOW, THEREFORE , in consideration of the foregoing premises and the representations, warranties, covenants and agreements herein contained and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, ETON and Aucta, intending to be legally bound, hereby agree as follows:

HEREBY, IN CONSIDERATION of the stipulations preceding this agreement, the representations, warranties, promises, and undertakings herein enumerated, as well as other valuable considerations, ETON and Aucta, each willing to be bound by law, hereby consent as follows:

In the event that any claims or disputes arise between the parties, Eton shall have the discretion to resolve such matters through mediation or arbitration, rather than litigation. The parties acknowledge and accept this option, recognizing the potential benefits of a more expedient and cost-effective resolution process.

The above modification aims to shift responsibility for resolving disputes from litigation to alternative dispute resolution methods like mediation or arbitration. This change is intended to streamline dispute resolution processes, potentially saving time and resources for both parties.

original: 1.8 “Calendar Quarter ” means a three (3) consecutive month period ending on March 31, June 30, September 30 or December 31.
modified:
1.8 "Calendar Quarter" denotes a span of three (3) consecutive months, concluding on May 31st, August 31st, November 30th, or February 28th (in non-leap years).

This revision changes the end dates of each quarter to create a slight shift in the reporting timeline. The original clause ended quarters on key fiscal dates (March 31, June 30, September 30, and December 31), whereas this revised version ends them on the last day of the third month of each quarter, providing a more even distribution of time periods throughout the year.

original: 2. GRANT OF RIGHTS 2.1 Aucta, for itself and its Affiliates, hereby grants to ETON in accordance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement, an exclusive (even as to and against Aucta in the Territory) right and license, including the right to sublicense, to the Products (or any components thereof), Dossiers, and all current and future Aucta Background Intellectual Property that is owned or controlled by Aucta or its Affiliates for ETON to develop, manufacture, import, use, promote, distribute, market, advertise, offer for sale or sell (collectively, “ Market ”) the Products in and for the Territory. For avoidance of doubt, Aucta and its Affiliates shall retain all rights to the Products outside the Territory, and Aucta shall remain at all times the owner of all Products, Dossier and Aucta Background Intellectual Property worldwide including the Territory.
modified:
2. GRANT OF RIGHTS

2.1 ETON, on its own behalf and Affiliates, is granted, in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement, a non-exclusive (i.e., not exclusive as to and against Aucta or its Affiliates within the Territory) right and license, with the ability to sub-license, to the Products (or any constituent parts), Dossiers, and all current and future Aucta Background Intellectual Property owned or managed by Aucta or its Affiliates. This grant enables ETON to undertake activities such as developing, manufacturing, importing, using, promoting, distributing, marketing, advertising, offering for sale, or selling (collectively, “Market”) the Products within the Territory. It is clarified that Aucta and its Affiliates retain all rights to the Products globally, excluding the Territory, and Aucta will continue to be the worldwide owner of all Products, Dossier, and Aucta Background Intellectual Property, including within the Territory.

original: (b) An amount of two million dollars ($2,000,000) within thirty (30) days after the first commercial sales of Product. [ * * * (c) An amount of one million dollars ($1,000,000) within thirty (30) days after the issuance and listing of a patent in the Orange Book for the Product and its Dossier, only if that patent is listed prior to the submission of an ANDA referencing the Product and its Dossier as the reference product.

(b) The recipient shall be obliged to remit an amount of two million dollars ($2,000,000) within thirty (30) days following the initial revenue generated from commercial sales of the Product.

   (c) Contingent upon the listing of a patent for the Product and its Dossier in the Orange Book prior to any ANDA submission referencing the Product and its Dossier as the reference product, the recipient shall provide an additional one million dollars ($1,000,000) within thirty (30) days following such listing. [ * * * ]

original: (c) An amount of five million dollars ($5,000,000) upon Net Sales first exceeding an amount of fifty million dollars ($50,000,000) in a calendar year to be paid within sixty (60) days after the calendar year end.
ollama_generated:
(c) A payment of five million dollars ($5,000,000) will become due and payable if and only if Net Sales for any given calendar year exceed fifty million dollars ($50,000,000). Such payment shall be made within sixty (60) days following the close of the calendar year, provided that the obligation to make such payment may be waived by either party in writing at any time prior to the due date.

This revision weakens the obligation slightly by introducing a possibility for either party to waive the payment before it is due, thus shifting some responsibility to both parties.

original: 6.3 Royalty .
modified:
6.3 Royalties Exemption.

The Company shall not be obligated to pay any royalties with respect to the Product, except in the event that the Product exceeds sales of one million (1,000,000) units within a consecutive twelve-month period, in which case the royalty percentage shall be as set forth in Section 7.2.

original: 6.4 [ * * * ] 6.5 Interim and Final True-Ups . During the Term, on an annual basis, following the first (1st) calendar year from launch of Product and on a Product-by-Product basis, ETON shall perform an interim “true-up” reconciliation and shall provide Aucta with a written report of such outlining the deductions specified in the definition of Net Sales. The reconciliation shall be based on actual cash paid or credits issued or accrued in accordance with GAAP and company practices consistently applied, including any amounts irrevocably committed but not yet paid at the end of the preceding calendar year. If the foregoing reconciliation report shows either an underpayment or an overpayment between the Parties, the Party owing payment to the other Party shall pay the amount of the difference to the other Party within thirty (30) days after the date of delivery of such report. In addition, within twenty-five (25) months after the termination or expiration of the Term and on a Product-by-Product basis, ETON shall perform a final “true-up” reconciliation and shall provide Aucta with a written report of such outlining the deductions specified in the definition of Net Sales. If the foregoing reconciliation report shows either an underpayment or an overpayment between the Parties, the Party owing payment to the other Party shall pay the amount of the difference to the other Party within thirty (30) days after the date of delivery of such report.
ollama_generated:
6.4 [ * * * ] 6.5 Interim and Final True-Ups . During the Term, on an annual basis, following the first (1st) calendar year from launch of Product and on a Product-by-Product basis, Aucta shall have the right to request a reconciliation report from ETON. The report will outline deductions specified in the definition of Net Sales and will be based on actual cash paid or credits issued or accrued in accordance with GAAP and company practices consistently applied, including any amounts irrevocably committed but not yet paid at the end of the preceding calendar year. It is the responsibility of Aucta to verify and confirm the accuracy of this report. Any discrepancies between the Parties, either an underpayment or an overpayment, will be settled amicably within a reasonable timeframe without the need for legal action.

In addition, within twenty-five (25) months after the termination or expiration of the Term and on a Product-by-Product basis, Aucta may request a final “true-up” reconciliation report from ETON. Any discrepancies between the Parties, either an underpayment or an overpayment, will be settled amicably within a reasonable timeframe without the need for legal action. The onus of proof and any subsequent payment shall lie with the Party claiming a discrepancy.

original: 7.2 At its sole cost and expense, ETON shall be solely responsible and liable for any non-patent litigation in connection with its sales and marketing activities.
modified: 7.2 It is exclusively the responsibility and liability of the counterparty, at their own expense, to handle any non-patent litigations that may arise from our business transactions involving sales and marketing. In this context, we, ETON, shall not be held accountable for such disputes.

original: 7.5.1 Other than an ANDA Litigation covered below in Section 7.5.2, Aucta shall at its sole cost and expense be solely responsible and liable for and assume the direction and control of any Intellectual Rights Suit and the defense of claims arising therefrom, including, without limitation, the selection of legal counsel; provided, however, that Aucta shall keep ETON apprised of material developments.
modified: 7.5.1 Excluding ANDA Litigations detailed in Section 7.5.2, ETON shall bear the responsibility and liability for any Intellectual Rights Suit at its sole expense. In this arrangement, Aucta retains the right to provide input and advice but does not assume control or primary responsibility for the defense or resolution of these claims.

original: 7.5.3 The Parties agree that they will not, whether in the context of the Intellectual Rights Suit, ANDA Litigation or otherwise related thereto, without the prior written consent of the other Party enter into any agreement or arrangement with any Third Party which in any way compromises, relinquishes, waives, or otherwise affects, in whole or in part, the rights of the other Party under this Agreement or in respect of the Product, including, without limitation, any patent rights related to the Product.
modified: 7.5.3 The Parties understand that they retain the discretionary freedom to engage with Third Parties, should such opportunities arise, in the context of the Intellectual Rights Suit, ANDA Litigation or otherwise related thereto, provided that any agreement or arrangement entered into shall not encroach upon, restrict, or diminish, in whole or in part, the rights of either Party under this Agreement or in relation to the Product, including but not limited to patent rights associated with the Product. The Parties acknowledge that prior written consent from the other Party is not required unless the agreement or arrangement in question may potentially infringe upon the aforementioned rights as defined within this Agreement.

original: 9.3 Public Announcement . Neither ETON, Aucta nor any of their respective Affiliates shall issue any press release or make any public announcement with respect to this Agreement and the transactions contemplated hereby without obtaining the prior written consent of the other Party, except as may be required by Applicable Law or stock exchange rules on which a Party or its Affiliates stock trades.
modified: 9.3 Public Disclosures Exemption: Each Party and their respective Affiliates reserve the right to issue press releases or make public announcements pertaining to this Agreement and associated transactions, provided that such disclosure is compelled by Applicable Law or stock exchange rules where a Party or its Affiliates' stocks are traded. Prior written consent from the other Party will not be sought in these instances.

original: 12.2 Aucta Representation and Warranties.  Aucta represents and warrants to ETON that:

13. INDEMNIFICATION 13.1 Aucta’s Indemnification Obligations . Aucta shall indemnify, defend and hold ETON and its owners, officers, directors, Affiliates, and employees (collectively, “ ETON Indemnified Parties ”) harmless from and against any and all Losses arising out of or resulting from any Third Party Claims made or suits brought against ETON Indemnified Parties which arise or result from (i) Aucta’s material breach of any of its representations, warranties or covenants set forth in this Agreement, or any of its obligations hereunder; (ii) Aucta’s manufacture, registration, handling, storage, use, transportation of any Product on or after the Effective Date, including, without limitation, any Claim for personal injury or death, to the extent such Third Party Claims arise from the period of time commencing on or after the Effective Date and to the extent such is not attributable to ETON’s breach of this Agreement or any Applicable Laws; or (iii) Aucta’s negligence or willful misconduct with regard to the Products to the extent such is not attributable to ETON’s breach of this Agreement or any Applicable Laws.
ollama_generated:
13. INDEMNIFICATION

13.1 ETON's Indemnification Obligations . ETON shall indemnify, defend and hold Aucta and its owners, officers, directors, Affiliates, and employees (collectively, "Aucta Indemnified Parties") harmless from and against any and all Losses arising out of or resulting from any Third Party Claims made or suits brought against Aucta Indemnified Parties which arise or result from (i) ETON's material breach of any of its representations, warranties or covenants set forth in this Agreement, or any of its obligations hereunder; (ii) any defect or issue with the Products that were present prior to the Effective Date, including, without limitation, any Claim for personal injury or death, to the extent such Third Party Claims arise from the period of time commencing on or before the Effective Date and to the extent such is not attributable to Aucta’s breach of this Agreement or any Applicable Laws; or (iii) ETON's negligence or willful misconduct with regard to the Products, to the extent such is not attributable to Aucta’s breach of this Agreement or any Applicable Laws.

original: 15. MISCELLANEOUS 15.1 Governing Law; English Language . This Agreement shall be governed, interpreted and construed in accordance with the substantive laws of the Delaware, in the country of the United State of America, without regard to its conflict of laws principles. To the extent that it may otherwise by applicable, the Parties hereby expressly agree to unconditionally waive and exclude from the operation of this Agreement the United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods, concluded at Vienna, on 11 April 1980, as amended and as may be amended further from time to time. This Agreement has been negotiated and drafted by the Parties in the English language. Any translation into any other language shall not be an official version thereof. In the event any translation of this Agreement is prepared for convenience or for any other purpose, the provisions of the English version shall prevail.
ollama_generated:
15. MISCELLANEOUS
15.1 Jurisdiction and Language
This Agreement will be subject to the jurisdiction and interpretation of the courts within Delaware, United States of America, under the principles governing domestic law, disregarding any conflicts of law provisions that might otherwise apply. The parties mutually agree to exclude from this contract the United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods, as enacted at Vienna, April 11, 1980, and any subsequent amendments, unless required by applicable local law. This Agreement was drafted and agreed upon in English. Any translation into another language is not binding and serves only as a convenience; the provisions of the English version shall take precedence in case of discrepancies.

In the event that a translation of this Agreement is prepared for any reason, it will not supersede or alter the original English text.

original: ETON Pharmaceuticals, Inc.

Responsibility for Compliance Shifts to Counterparty:
Counterparty shall assume all obligations under this agreement regarding compliance with applicable laws, regulations, and industry standards related to the manufacture, sale, distribution, and promotion of pharmaceutical products, as well as the quality control and assurance thereof. ETON Pharmaceuticals, Inc. shall cooperate in good faith to facilitate such compliance; however, any non-compliance shall be solely attributable to Counterparty's actions or omissions.

original: 15.8 Assignment . The terms and provisions hereof shall inure to the benefit of, and be binding upon the Parties and their respective successors and permitted assigns. The Parties shall not assign, encumber or otherwise transfer this Agreement or any part of it to any Third Party, without the prior written consent of the other Party. Notwithstanding the foregoing, each Party may assign the rights and obligations under this Agreement in whole, without consent of the other Party, to a Third Party or Affiliate in connection with the transfer or sale of all or substantially all of its business or in the event of a merger, consolidation or change in control provided that the assignee assumes in writing and becomes directly obligated to the other Party to perform all of the obligations of assignor under this Agreement.
modified: 15.8 Assignment. The rights and duties established by this Agreement shall survive and be enforceable against any successors or permitted assignees of the Parties. Unlike the initial terms, either Party may freely transfer, assign, or encumber this Agreement, or any part thereof, to a Third Party or Affiliate, without requiring the prior written consent of the other Party. However, in such cases, the Party making the assignment shall remain liable for any breaches or failures to comply with the terms of this Agreement by their assignee. Exceptions to this rule include transfers or sales of all or substantially all of a Party's business, as well as mergers, consolidations, or changes in control, provided that the transferee explicitly assumes and becomes directly responsible for performing all the obligations of the assigning Party under this Agreement.

original: 15.11 Counterparts; PDF . This Agreement may be executed in two (2) or more counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original but all of which, taken together, shall constitute one and the same instrument. PDF and facsimile signatures shall constitute original signatures. The Parties agree that the electronic signatures appearing on this Agreement are the same as handwritten signatures for the purposes of validity, enforceability and admissibility pursuant to the Electronic Signatures in Global and National Commerce (ESIGN) Act of 2000, and Uniform Electronic Transactions Act (UETA) model law, or similar applicable laws.
ollama_generated:
15.11 Multiple Execution; Electronic Signatures

This Agreement may be executed as separate documents by all parties involved, with each individual document considered a valid and binding portion of the overall agreement. Collectively, these separate parts will form a single unified instrument.

Electronic signatures and facsimile signatures on this Agreement are deemed equivalent to traditional handwritten signatures for the purposes of legitimacy, enforceability, and admissibility under the Electronic Signatures in Global and National Commerce (ESIGN) Act of 2000, Uniform Electronic Transactions Act (UETA) model law, or similar applicable laws.

The parties acknowledge that the electronic signatures on this Agreement serve as a legally binding substitute for traditional handwritten signatures. It is understood that the validity, enforceability, and admissibility of this Agreement are not compromised due to the use of electronic signatures in accordance with relevant legislation, including but not limited to the ESIGN Act, UETA, or similar applicable laws.

ollama_generated: In the event that any claim or dispute arises between the parties in connection with this Agreement, it shall be the responsibility of the aggrieved party to initiate a resolution process within sixty (60) days from the date on which such claim or dispute arose. If no resolution is reached within such timeframe, the non-aggrieved party shall not be obligated to participate in further discussions unless it elects to do so voluntarily and without prejudice. The burden of proof in any subsequent litigation arising from the unresolved claim or dispute shall rest with the party initiating the resolution process.
